summary: The position of inspector general was established in federal agencies to prevent and detect fraud, waste, and abuse; conduct investigations; and more. The IG Act of 1978 recognized independence as key to IG effectiveness. IGs follow the auditing standards that GAO sets, which seek to address threats to auditors’—including IGs’—independence. Various legislative proposals to strengthen IG independence have been introduced in the current Congress, and...
title: Inspectors General: Independence Principles and Considerations for Reform
